ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:0.5_0: 24. The second training rule on covering the head
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six were covering their heads with their robes while sitting in inhabited areas. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:1.3.1_0: “‘I will not cover my head while sitting in inhabited areas;’ this is how you should train.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:1.4_0: One should not cover one’s head while sitting in an inhabited area.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:1.5_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, covers his head with his upper robe while sitting in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:1.12_0: They burn in times of trouble,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:1.15_0: The fourth rule, the training rule on fire, is finished.
